An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 343

spell.name: Maneuver: Ambush
spell.text: When you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check or an Initiative roll, you can expend one Superiority Die and add the die to the roll, unless you have the Incapacitated condition.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 94

spell.name: Maneuver: Bait and Switch
spell.text: When you're within 5 feet of a creature on your turn, you can expend one Superiority Die and switch places with that creature, provided you spend at least 5 feet of movement and the creature is willing and doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. This movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.
Roll the Superiority Die. Until the start of your next turn, you or the other creature ,(your choice) gains a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 94

spell.name: Maneuver: Commander's Strike
spell.text: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to direct one of your companions to s trike. When you do so, choose a willing creature who can see or hear you and expend one Superiority Die. That creature can immediately use its Reaction to make one attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, adding the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll on a hit.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 94

spell.name: Maneuver: Commanding Presence
spell.text: When you make a Charisma (Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion) check, you can expend one Superiority Die and add that die to the roll.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Disarming Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to disarm t he target. Add the Superiority Die roll to the attack's damage roll. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop one object of your choice that it's holding, with the object landing in its space.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Distracting Strike
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die to distract the target. Add the Superiority Die roll to the attack's damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has Advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Evasive Footwork
spell.text: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one Superiority Die and take the Disengage action. You also roll the die and add the number rolled to your AC until the start of your next turn.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Feinting Attack
spell.text: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one Superiority Die to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of yourself as your target. You have Advantage on your next attack roll against that target this turn. If that attack hits, add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Goading Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. Add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Lunging Attack
spell.text: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one Superiority Die and take the Dash action. If you move at least 5 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting with a melee attack as part of the Attack action on this turn, you can add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Maneuvering Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die to maneuver one of your comrades into another position. Add the Superiority Die roll to the attack's damage roll, and choose a willing creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its Reaction to move up to half its Speed without provoking an Opportunity Attack from the target of your attack.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Menacing Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to frighten the target. Add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the end of your next turn.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Parry
spell.text: When another creature damages you with a melee attack roll, you can take a Reaction and expend one Superiority Die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your Superiority Die plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Precision Attack
spell.text: When you miss with an attack roll, you can expend one Superiority Die. roll that die, and add it to the attack roll. potentially causing the attack to hit.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Pushing Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike. you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to drive the target back. Add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from you.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Rally
spell.text: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one Superiority Die to bolster the resolve of a companion. Choose an ally of yours within 30 feet of yourself who can see or hear you. That creature gains Temporary Hit Points equal to the Superiority Die roll plus half your Fighter level (round down).
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Riposte
spell.text: When a creature misses you with a melee attack roll, you can take a Reaction and expend one Superiority Die to make a melee attack roll with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike against the creature. If you hit, add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Sweeping Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to damage another creature. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your Superiority Die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Tactical Assessment
spell.text: When you make an Intelligence (History or Investigation) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check, you can expend one Superiority Die and add that die to the ability check.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Maneuver: Trip Attack
spell.text: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend one Superiority Die and add the die to the attack's damage roll. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Prone condition.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 95

spell.name: Metamagic: Careful Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, spend 1 Sorcery Point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, and it takes no damage if it would normally take half damage on a successful save.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 141

spell.name: Metamagic: Distant Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell that has a range of at least 5 feet, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double the spell's range. Or when you cast a spell that has a range of Touch, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to make the spell's range 30 feet.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 141

spell.name: Metamagic: Empowered Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point
When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), and you must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you've already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Extended Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point
When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double its duration to a maximum duration of 24 hours.
If the affected spell requires Concentration, you have Advantage on any saving throw you make to maintain that Concentration.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Heightened Spell
spell.text: Cost: 2 Sorcery Points
When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to give one target of the spell Disadvantage on saves against the spell.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
spell.text: Cost: 2 Sorcery Points

When you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to change the casting time to a Bonus Action for this casting. You can't modify a spell in this way if you've already cast a level 1+ spell on the current turn, nor can you cast a level 1+ spell on this turn aA:er modifying a spell in this way.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Seeking Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point
If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you've already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Subtle Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast it without any Verbal, Somatic, or Material components, except Material components that are consumed by the spell or that have a cost specified in the spell.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Transmuted Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Thunder.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
spell.text: Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell, such as Charm Person, that can be cast with a higher-level spell slot to target an additional creature, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to increase the spell's effective level by 1.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 142

spell.name: Invocation: Agonizing Blast
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock, a Warlock Cantrip That Deals Damage
Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that deals damage. You can add your Charisma modifier to that spell's damage rolls.
Repeatable. You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Armor Of Shadows
spell.text: You can cast Mage Armor on yourself without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Ascendant Step
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock
You can cast Levitate on yourself without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Devil's Sight
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock
You can see normally in Dim Light and Darkness-both magical and nonmagical- within 120 feet of yourself.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Devouring Blade
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 12+ Warlock, Thirsting Blade Invocation
The Extra Attack of your Thirsting Blade invocation confers two extra attacks rather than one.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Eldritch Mind
spell.text: You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain Concentration.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Eldritch Smite
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock, Pact of the Blade Invocation

Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a Pact Magic spell slot to deal an extra 1d8 Force damage to the target, plus another 1d8 per level of the spell slot, and you can give the target the Prone condition if it is Huge or smaller.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Eldritch Spear
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock, a Warlock Cantrip That Deals Damage
Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that deals damage and has a range of 10+ feet. When you cast that spell, its range increases by a number of feet equal to 30 times your Warlock level.
Repeatable. You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Fiendish Vigor
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock

You can cast False Life on yourself without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell with this feature, you don't roll the die for the Temporary Hit Points; you automatically get the highest number on the die.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 155

spell.name: Invocation: Gaze Of Two Minds
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock

You can use a Bonus Action to touch a willing creature and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can take a Bonus Action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. The connection ends if you don't maintain it in this way.

While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you can cast spells as if you were in your space or the other creature's space if the two of you are within 60 feet of each other.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Gift Of The Depths
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock
You can breathe underwater, and you gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.
You can also cast Water Breathing once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way again when you finish a Long Rest.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Gift Of The Protectors
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 9+ Warlock, Pact of the Tome Invocation

A new page appears in your Book of Shadows when you conjure it. With your permission, a creature can take an action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one name).

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 Hit Point instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a Long Rest.
As a Magic action, you can erase a name on the page by touching it.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Investment Of The Chain Master
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock, Pact of the Chain Invocation
When you cast Find Familiar, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits.
Aerial or Aquatic. The familiar gains either a Fly Speed or a Swim Speed (your choice) of 40 feet.
Quick Attack. As a Bonus Action, you can command the familiar to take the Attack action.
Necrotic or Radiant Damage. Whenever the familiar deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, you can make it deal Necrotic or Radiant damage instead.
Your Save DC. If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.
Resistance. When the familiar takes damage, you can take a Reaction to grant it Resistance against that damage.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Lessons Of The First Ones
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock
You have received knowledge from an elder entity of the multiverse, allowing you to gain one Origin feat of your choice (see chapter 5).
Repeatable. You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different Origin feat.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Lifedrinker
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 9+ Warlock, Pact of the Blade Invocation

Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can deal an extra 1d6 Necrotic, Psychic, or Radiant damage (your choice) to the creature, and you can expend one of your Hit Point Dice to roll it and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 Hit Point).
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Mask Of Many Faces
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock
You can cast Disguise Self without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Master Of Myriad Forms
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock
You can cast Alter Self without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Misty Visions
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock
You can cast Silent Image without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: One With Shadows
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock
While you're in an area of Dim Light or Darkness, you can cast Invisibility on yourself without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Otherworldly Leap
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock
You can cast jump on yourself without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Pact Of The Blade
spell.text: As a Bonus Action, you can conjure a pact weapon in your hand- a Simple or Martial Melee weapon of your choice with which you bond-or create a bond with a magic weapon you touch; you can't bond with a magic weapon if someone else is attuned to it or another Warlock is bonded with it. Until t!he bond ends, you have proficiency with the weapon, and you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus.

Whenever you attack with the bonded weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity; and you can cause the weapon to deal Necrotic, Psychic, or Radiant damage or its normal damage type.

Your bond with the weapon ends if you use this feature's Bonus Action again, if the weapon is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more, or if you die. A conjured weapon disappears when the bond ends.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 156

spell.name: Invocation: Pact Of The Chain
spell.text: You learn the Find Familiar spell and can cast it as a Magic action without expending a spell slot.

When you cast the spell, you choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: Imp, Pseudodragon, Quasit, Skeleton, Slaad Tadpole, Sphinx of Wonder, Sprite, or Venomous Snake (see appendix B for the familiar's stat block).
Additionally, when you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to make one attack of its own with its Reaction.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Pact Of The Tome
spell.text: Stitching together strands of shadow, you conjure forth a book in your hand at the end of a Short or Long Rest. This Book of Shadows (you determine its appearance) contains eldritch magic that only you can access, granting you the benefits below. The book disappears if you conjure another book with this feature or if you die.

Cantrips and Rituals. When the book appears, choose three cantrips, and choose two level 1 spells that have the Ritual tag. The spells can be from any class's spell list, and they must be spells you don't already have prepared. While the book is on your person, you have the chosen spells prepared, and they function as Warlock spells for you.
Spellcasting Focus. You can use the book as a Spellcasting Focus.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Repelling Blast
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 2+ Warlock, a Warlock Cantrip That Deals Damage via an Attack Roll
Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that requires an attack roll. When you hit a Large or smaller creature with that cantrip, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from you.
Repeatable. You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Thirsting Blade
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock, Pact of the Blade Invocation
You gain the Extra Attack feature for your pact weapon only. With that feature, you can attack twice with the weapon instead of once when you take the Attack action on your turn.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Visions Of Distant Realms
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 9+ Warlock
You can cast Arcane Eye without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Whispers Of The Grave
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 7+ Warlock
You can cast Speak with Dead without expending a spell slot.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

spell.name: Invocation: Witch Sight
spell.text: Prerequisite: Level 15+ Warlock
You have Truesight with a range of 30 feet.
Source: Player's Handbook 2024 p. 157

monster.name: Aberrant Spirit
monster.languages: Deep Speech, understands the languages you know

trait.name: Regeneration (Slaad Only)
trait.text: The spirit regains 5 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

trait.name: Whispering Aura (Mind Flayer Only)
trait.text: At the start of each of the spirit's turns, the spirit emits psionic energy if it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, each creature (other than you) within 5 feet of the spirit. Failure: 2d6 Psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Claw (Slaad Only)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Slashing damage, and the target can't regain Hit Points until the start of the spirit's next turn.

action.name: Eye Ray (Beholderkin Only)
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range 150 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Slam (Mind Flayer Only)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Psychic damage.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: Force damage equal to 1d4 + 3 + your spellcasting ability modifier (Medium or smaller), 2d6 + 3 + your spellcasting ability modifier (Large), or 2d12 + 3 + your spellcasting ability modifier (Huge).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ape makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock (Recharge 6)

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: Add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw the beast makes.

action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 2 plus your Wisdom modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice when you summon the beast). If the beast moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target before the hit, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage of the same type, and the target has the Prone condition if it is a Large or smaller creature.

trait.text: 5 plus five times your Ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Ranger level)

trait.name: Amphibious

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: Add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw the beast makes.

action.name: Beast's Strike

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 4 plus four times your Ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your Ranger level)

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The beast doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Primal Bond
trait.text: Add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw the beast makes.

action.name: Beast's Strike
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d4 + 3 plus your Wisdom modifier Slashing damage.

action.name: Gore

action.name: Multiattack

trait.name: Jumper

action.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)

trait.name: Stony Lethargy (Stone Only)

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, the target. Failure: Until the start of its next turn, the target can't make Opportunity Attacks, and its Speed is halved.

action.name: Multiattack

action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel Bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Berserk Lashing (Clay Only)

trait.name: Amphibious

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 12). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage, and the target has the Prone condition if it is Huge or smaller.

monster.name: Draconic Spirit
monster.languages: Draconic, understands the languages you know

trait.name: Shared Resistances
trait.text: When you summon the spirit, choose one of its Resistances. You have Resistance to the chosen damage type until the spell ends.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Rend

action.name: Breath Weapon
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 2d6 damage of a type this spirit has Resistance to (your choice when you cast the spell). Success: Half damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Elemental Spirit
monster.speed: 40 ft., fly 40 ft.(hover; Air only), burrow 40 ft.(Earth only), swim 40 ft.(Water only)
monster.resist: lightning, thunder (Air only); piercing, slashing (Earth only); acid (Water only)
monster.languages: Primordial, understands the languages you know

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
trait.text: The spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without it counting as Difficult Terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirit makes a number of Slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + summonSpellLevel Bludgeoning (Earth only), Cold (Water only), Lightning (Air only), or Fire (Fire only) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elephant makes two Gore attacks.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage. If the elephant moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target also has the Prone condition.

action.name: Trample (bonus action)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature within 5 feet that has the Prone condition. Failure: 17 (2d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

monster.name: Fey Spirit
monster.languages: Sylvan, understands the languages you know

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirit makes a number of Fey Blade attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Fey Blade
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 2d6 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Force damage.

action.name: Fey Step (bonus action)
action.text: The spirit magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Then one of the following effects occurs, based on the spirit's chosen mood:
Fuming. The spirit has Advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

Mirthful. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, one creature the spirit can see within 10 feet of itself. Failure: The target is Charmed by you and the spirit for 1 minute or until the target takes any damage.
Tricksy. The spirit fills a 10-foot Cube within 5 feet of it with magical Darkness, which lasts until the end of its next turn.

monster.speed: 40 ft., climb 40 ft.(Demon only), fly 60 ft.(Devil only)

trait.name: Death Throes (Demon Only)

trait.name: Devil's Sight (Devil Only)
trait.text: Magical Darkness doesn't impede the spirit's Darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance

action.name: Claws (Yugoloth Only)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Slashing damage. Immediately after the attack hits or misses, the spirit can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Fiery Strike (Devil Only)
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. or range 150 ft. Hit: 2d6 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Fire damage.

action.text: The imp changes into a form that resembles a rat (Speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., Fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., Climb 20 ft.), or it returns to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it's wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The imp reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Running Leap

action.name: Multiattack

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The mule counts as one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Hooves

trait.name: Compression
trait.text: The octopus can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without spending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Ink Cloud (1/Day)
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature ends its turn within 5 feet of the octopus while underwater. Response: The octopus releases ink that fills a 5-foot Cube centered on itself, and the octopus moves up to its Swim Speed. The Cube is Heavily Obscured for 1 minute or until a strong current or similar effect disperses the ink.

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5 + 10 per spell level (the steed has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to the spell's level)

trait.name: Life Bond
trait.text: When you regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell, the steed regains the same number of Hit Points if you're within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Otherworldly Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + summonSpellLevel of Radiant (Celestial), Psychic (Fey), or Necrotic (Fiend) damage.

action.name: Fell Glare (Fiend Only; Recharges after a Long Rest) (bonus action)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, one creature within 60 feet the steed can see. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of your next turn.

action.name: Fey Step (Fey Only; Recharges after a Long Rest) (bonus action)
action.text: The steed teleports, along with its rider, to an unoccupied space of your choice up to 60 feet away from itself.

action.name: Healing Touch (Celestial Only; Recharges after a Long Rest) (bonus action)
action.text: One creature within 5 feet of the steed regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 + summonSpellLevel.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The owl doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The panther makes one Pounce attack and uses Prowl.

action.name: Pounce
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage, or the panther deals 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage if it had Advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Prowl
action.text: The panther moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. At the end of this movement, the panther can take the Hide action.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Pseudodragon
monster.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The pseudodragon has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The pseudodragon makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

action.name: Sting
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw:DC 12, one creature the pseudodragon can see within 5 feet. Failure: 5 (2d4) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. Failure by 5 or More: The Poisoned target also has the Unconscious condition until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The quasit has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Invisibility
trait.text: The quasit casts Invisibility on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Slashing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the quasit's next turn.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The quasit changes into a form that resembles a bat (Speed 10 ft., Fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., Climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., Swim 40 ft.), or it returns to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it's wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The quasit reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Scare (1/Day)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 10, one creature within 20 feet. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically

trait.name: Agile
trait.text: The rat doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a whisper or chitter. A hearer can discern the sounds are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The shark has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

monster.name: Skeleton
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sphinx has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Radiant damage.

reaction.name: Burst of Ingenuity (2/Day)
reaction.text: Trigger: The sphinx or another creature within 30 feet makes an ability check or a saving throw. Response: The sphinx adds 2 to the roll.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the spider knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

trait.name: Invisibility
trait.text: The sprite casts Invisibility on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Needle Sword
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage.

action.name: Enchanting Bow
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 40/160 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the sprite's next turn.

action.name: Heart Sight
action.text: Charisma Saving Throw: DC 10, one creature within 5 feet the sprite can see. Celestials, Fiends, and Undead automatically fail the save. Failure: The sprite knows the target's emotions and alignment.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tiger makes one Pounce attack and uses Prowl.

action.name: Pounce
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage. If the tiger had Advantage on the attack roll, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) Slashing damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, has the Prone condition.

action.name: Prowl
action.text: The tiger moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. At the end of this movement, the tiger can take the Hide action.

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 30 (Ghostly and Putrid only) or 20 (Skeletal only) + 10 for each spell level above 3

trait.name: Festering Aura (Putrid Only)
trait.text: Constitution Saving Throw:DC equals your spell save DC, any creature (other than you) that starts its turn within a 5-foot Emanation originating from the spirit. Failure: The creature has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Incorporeal Passage (Ghostly Only)
trait.text: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 Force damage for every 5 feet traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Deathly Touch (Ghostly Only)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Necrotic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Grave Bolt (Skeletal Only)
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range 150 ft. Hit: 2d4 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Necrotic damage.

action.name: Rotting Claw (Putrid Only)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + summonSpellLevel Slashing damage. If the target has the Poisoned condition, it has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the horse moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) Bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, has the Prone condition.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage, and the target has the Prone condition if it is Medium or smaller.

monster.name: Zombie
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Bludgeoning damage.
